comments:
if i install 3.1m4 (the Platform Runtime Binary) on a solaris box and change the
config.ini by setting eclipse.product=org.eclipse.platform.ide (or anything else
for that matter), the new intro-style welcome page doesn't appear.  

if i then go to help-welcome, eclipse tries to display welcome.xml but fails
with a complaint about a NullPointerException in WelcomeEditor on line 714.

so, basically, both methods for introducing our product is broken with an
eclipse.product set.  i can't use the welcome.xml that worked in 3.01 (because
of the NullPointerException) and the newer IntroPart method doesn't seem to work
because i've specified an eclipse.product.  argh!

Brian,
the new product id that you are using, has it been defined using the new 3.0 
product extension point? somethijng like: 

  <extension  id="your.product.id" point="org.eclipse.core.runtime.products"> 
  <product name="my product" 
     application="org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench">     
  </product>       
</extension>

or at least, if you go to Help -> about, do you see the correct info for your 
product? 

Im just assuming that whatever setup you have did not define that product 
correctly.

when i use 3.01, the welcome.xml is displayed properly and within help, we get
our product branding.  here is our product declaration:

   <extension id="splusWorkbench" point="org.eclipse.core.runtime.products"> 
      <product name="%productName" application="org.eclipse.ui.ide.workbench"
description="%productBlurb"> 
          <property name="windowImages" value="splus.gif,splus32.gif"/> 
          <property name="aboutImage" value="splus_lg.gif"/> 
          <property name="aboutText" value="%productBlurb"/> 
          <property name="appName" value="S-PLUS Workbench"/> 
          <property name="welcomePage" value="welcome.xml"/> 
          <property name="preferenceCustomization"
value="plugin_customization.ini"/> 
      </product> 
   </extension> 

and, typically, we set the eclipse.product in config.ini like this:
   eclipse.product=com.insightful.splus.eclipse.platform.splusWorkbench

so, it's entirely possible that we're doing something wrong with the product
declaration, but, it all seemed to work in 3.01.

Created an attachment (id=17486)
very simple reproduce case

if you install the Platform Runtime Binary for 3.0.1 and 3.1m4 and unzip this
example (which will add a plugin that identifies itself as a product and
changes the config.ini to use this new product), 3.0.1 will allow you to see
the standard welcome.xml but 3.1m4 will not.

Brian,
apologies for the delay. 
so here is what is going on with this defect. Old legacy welcome is broken. 
You can not open a 2.0 style welcome. As for the new welcome, that should 
work. In the testcase that you gave me, you define a product, set it in the 
config .ini, but you do not define an intro (the new 3.0 intro). This is why 
the platform tried to display the old style welcome and you got the bug. 

If you are interested in the new style intro, look at how the SDK contributes 
it na dyou can follow the patter. 
If you interested in the legacy welcome, then this is a bug, and Im forwarding 
to the correct team. 


Forwarding to UI team: 

Legacy welcome is broken. To reproduce:
1) M5a 
2) in o.e.platform plugin.xml remove intro contribution.
3) run. You get legact welcome.
4) note that you get two Platform welcome.xmls and one of the crashes with : 

java.lang.ClassCastException

tor(WelcomeEditorActionContributor.java:33)

(EditorActionBars.java:310)

(InternalPlatform.java:1015)

Not going to look at legacy welcome bugs.
